statements: Public trust in institutions can grow when those institutions consistently earn it through transparency, fairness, and measurable results, while also respecting legitimate skepticism and criticism. We should pair stronger accountability—clear standards, independent oversight, and meaningful consequences for failures—with better communication and public participation so people can see how decisions are made and how feedback changes outcomes. At the same time, rebuilding trust requires shared responsibility: institutions must improve performance and integrity, and the public and leaders should engage in good-faith dialogue grounded in reliable evidence rather than misinformation.
